clinical_study.official_title: Ciprofloxacin, Ampicillin-sulbactam and Placebo Prophylaxis in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy. A Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: The trial aims to assess the value of two-regimen antibiotic prophylaxis versus placebo in elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy.

detailed_description.textblock: All patients enrolled will be submitted to laparoscopic cholecystectomy. The primary aim of the trial will be to assess the role of prophylactic i.v. infusion of ampicillin-sulbactam, ciprofloxacin, and placebo to reduce the rate of surgical site infection.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Surgical site infection defined according to the Centre of Disease Control (CDC) classification, recorded as 'yes' or 'no'.

secondary_outcome.description: Extra-abdominal infections defined according to the CDC classification, recorded as 'yes' or 'no'.
Adverse events, defined as allergic reactions to antibiotics.
Quality of life measured with the 36-Item Short Form Health Survey

arm_group.description: Intravenous infusion of 0.9% Sodium Chloride 250 ml during induction of anesthesia and before laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
Intravenous infusion of 3gr ampicillin-sulbactam in 0.9% Sodium Chloride 250 ml during induction of anesthesia and before laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
Intravenous infusion of 400 mg ciprofloxacin in 0.9% Sodium Chloride 250 ml during induction of anesthesia and before laparoscopic cholecystectomy.

intervention.description: Prophylactic ciprofloxacin infusion before elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy
Prophylactic ampicillin-sulbactam infusion before elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy
Prophylactic placebo infusion before elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy

facility.name: Sapienza University of Rome- Polo Pontino

reference.citation: Sanabria A, Dominguez LC, Valdivieso E, Gomez G. Antibiotic prophylaxis for patients undergoing elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy. Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2010 Dec 8;(12):CD005265. doi: 10.1002/14651858.CD005265.pub2. Review.
